Scan.Line: Chief Officer Doyle: "I can help you with many things, but this is not one of them."
Chief Officer Doyle: "We can talk once the case is closed. Stay focused on your task."
Chief Officer Doyle: "The woman's name is Anna Taylor. She was found dead in her home in the Notting Hill district. Here's the address. Maybe you should go there and investigate."e;
Chief Officer Doyle: "If you want to learn more about the personality of a suspect, it's good to ask other people what they think about them."
Chief Officer Doyle: "Did you think of asking her what she thinks about the victim?"
Chief Officer Doyle: "What about asking one of the forensic experts?"
Rose Butterfly: "I don't know what to say about this subject."
Rose Butterfly: "Anna was the President of the club, and we have this place thanks to her. She was my partner, and we owe her so much."
Rose Butterfly: "Yes, I admit that Anna was a difficult person, and to be honest, she was a lousy Bridge player. It's her money that made her President of the club."

Rose Butterfly: "My name is Rose Butterfly. I'm a florist. Bridge is more than just a passion for me, and Anna was my partner."
Rose Butterfly: "I'm happy to see new players coming."
Rose Butterfly: "I don't know what to say about this."
Rose Butterfly: "I love to make cream cakes. Sugar is still legal, isn't it?"
Rose Butterfly: "I love to make cream cakes. Sugar is still legal, isn't it?"
Rose Butterfly: "It's true. I confess. I sent a cake to Anna to get her sick and forfeit tomorrow's tournament. I never wanted her to die!"

Rose Butterfly: "Bridge is a game with such intensity... I love the adrenaline rush of the tournaments. There's an important one tomorrow with a big cash prize. With the right partner, I have an excellent chance to win it."

Rose Butterfly: "Anna was supposed to be my partner, but she sucked at Bridge. Her death is a tragedy I would have never wished upon her, though it's true that it will allow me to have a better partner for tomorrow and, hopefully, win the big prize."

Rose Butterfly: "It was always tricky to get Anna on the phone since she refused to have a cell phone."
Rose Butterfly: "You need to be careful with the Foxglove flower. It's dangerous because of the digitalis it contains. But it's beautiful, nonetheless."
Rose Butterfly: "It's true. I wrote this letter. I will speak frankly since you know the tensions between myself and Anna."
Rose Butterfly: "I'm a florist, so I know a lot about flowers."
Jenny May: "I don't recognize this, should I?
Jenny May: "Anna was the president of the Bridge club, and we owe a lot to her. She was the teammate of one of our best players, Rose. Rose is here today."
Jenny May: "Rose is competitive, and she often argued with Anna because they were losing more and more often. But they most likely reconciled because Rose sent a cake to Anna yesterday."
Jenny May: "My name is Jenny May, and I'm a veterinarian. It's my day off today, but I'm totally exhausted after working more than 12 hours yesterday."
Jenny May: "I would like to help you, but I don't know anything about this subject."

Jenny May: "Anna asked me a few times to pass by her place and check on her cats. Poor little ones, they had a cholesterol problem. I kept telling Anna not to feed them human food, but I think she was doing it anyway."
Jenny May: "I heard Rose on the phone with a delivery man. She was trying to get a cake delivered to Anna.

Jenny May: "I discovered Bridge only recently and love it! I often lose, but not like Rose, who wins almost every single tournament! There is one tomorrow, actually, with a big cash prize for the winning team."
Jenny May: "I don't know Anna's phone number. I had no reason to call her."
Jenny May: "I do use many dangerous substances when I have to put down animals, but definitely not digitalis."
Jenny May: "I've never seen this letter before."
Eric Gloomerry: "I need more info before I can do that research."
Eric Gloomerry: "He's a good fellow who saved my life on more than one occasion when I was...let's just say...on the borders of legality."
Eric Gloomerry: "A quick Internet search found that she was president of a Bridge club in Leicester Square."
Eric Gloomerry: "She's registered for a Bridge tournament tomorrow with a big cash prize for the winner. Guess who was supposed to be her partner? BINGO! Our victim, Anna."
Eric Gloomerry: "I'm not the one who can help you with this."
Eric Gloomerry: "I've discovered that the cake was delivered around 8pm to Anna Taylor. The credit card with the name 'Rose Butterfly' paid for the order."
Eric Gloomerry: "You should pick up the phone first before I can analyze it. Type in 'Goodbye' and then 'View Phone' to pick up the phone as evidence."

Eric Gloomerry: "I can't believe these old things still exist! Luckily it's linked to the network with the same usual wires. I was able to find the last call yesterday at 6:15 pm. It came from the phone of a lady named 'Rose Butterfly.'"
Jeremy King: "A corpse is a mystery that an autopsy attempts to solve, but honestly, I'm not sure this person would have wanted to be opened with my scalpel."
Jeremy King: "The woman died around 10:30 pm yesterday. Her heart just stopped. We have found an unusually large amount of digitalis, a poisonous plant residue that can provoke a cardiac arrest."
Jeremy King: "To each his own. My specialty is medicine, especially that of those who no longer move."
Jeremy King: "Doctor Schrödinger's theories are useless. The cats died of digitalis poisoning."
Harvey Marshall: "Criminals are complex beings. I need a little more information to figure this out."
Harvey Marshall: "Ah! The Chief Officer… There's so much to say about this man, but I'm pretty sure now's not the time."
Harvey Marshall: "An old lady who grew up during the war, and who was extremely stingy with her money."

Harvey Marshall: "A compulsive fighter who will do whatever it takes to get what she wants. She makes her presence loud and clear with her extreme quirkiness. You will most likely find her at the Leicester Square Bridge Club."
Harvey Marshall: "A young lady, very serious, who works as a vet. You could say that she has succeeded in life. She is now looking to give a meaning to it."
Harvey Marshall: "Each object has a criminal history related to it, but this one isn't necessarily linked with your current investigation."

Harvey Marshall: "In California, an American was sentenced to 16 years in prison for killing 18 cats and injuring 3 others. ...I don't know if this information will be beneficial to your investigation."
Harvey Marshall: "Wasting such a delicious looking cake, that is criminal indeed. Try to find out who sent it."

Harvey Marshall: "This particular deck is used to play bridge. It's a game played by teams of 2, where one partner can become what is called 'the dummy.' In some countries, the dummy is called 'the dead.' Anna Taylor was part of a bridge club in Leicester Square.
Harvey Marshall: "Criminals are becoming more wary of phone tapping.

Harvey Marshall: "Poison is often used by killers who don't like physical violence. The serial killer Marie Becker, also called the Black Widow, was famous for using digitalis. Remember that getting the right dosage of poison is difficult, and it can sometimes kill by accident."
Harvey Marshall: "Our victim, Anna Taylor, was part of a Bridge Club in Leicester Square. Apparently, her partner did not want her to participate in the tournament."
Lou Chin: "My microscope doesn't really work so well on people."
Lou Chin: "I need evidence to perform an analysis. Did you pick up the object you want me to analyze? Get out of Interrogation Mode and 'View' the object you want to pick up."
Lou Chin: "Who could be so cruel as to kill a sweet little kitty.... Unfortunately, animal corpses are not my area of expertise."
Lou Chin: "My analysis confirms traces of digitalis inside the cake. The quantity might not have been harmful to you or me, but would have been fatal to an older woman like the victim."
Lou Chin: "Scientifically, there's nothing to say about the cards. The criminologist might be able to help you more."
Lou Chin: "Scientifically, there's nothing to say about the phone. The Hacker might help you on this."
Lou Chin: "Digitoxin or digitalis is a cardiac glycoside extract from a flower commonly called the Foxglove, or in Latin, Digitalis purpurea."
Lou Chin: "Unfortunately, it's a letter without any identifiable fingerprints."
